name: Corfe Common history walk, Corfe Castle

ai.summary: A flat, easy 4.7 km heritage walk around Corfe Common with views toward Corfe Castle. This family-friendly route blends open commonland with historic features along well-marked footpaths and light lanes, making it suitable for casual walkers and visitors interested in local history.
ai.terrain_summary: The route uses mostly well-maintained footpaths and grassy tracks. Expect a few gravel sections, occasional uneven stones, and gentle gradients. After rain it can be muddy in places; some short road or lane sections may be encountered near the village.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear and dress for changing weather. Stay on approved paths, mind uneven surfaces, and watch for road crossings. Keep dogs on a short leash where required. Stay hydrated, carry a small first aid kit, and respect farmland and wildlife; if visibility is poor, consider postponing the walk.
recommended_gear: Map or reliable navigation on a phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn offer the most comfortable conditions for this 4.7 km walk, but the route is accessible year round; prepare for wetter conditions and shorter daylight in winter.
